means: 把…模式化，使成陈规( stereotype的过去式和过去分词 )

sentence.Network_en: You are likely to find many people who have stereotyped ideas about women.
sentence.Network_cn: 你很可能会发现很多人对女性都抱有老一套的看法。

sentence.Network_en: I get very worked up about the way women are stereotyped in a lot of mainstream films.
sentence.Network_cn: 我对很多主流电影中千篇一律的女性形象感到非常气愤。

sentence.Network_en: There is a sameness about all these tales . They're so stereotyped -- all about talented scholars and lovely ladies.
sentence.Network_cn: 这些书就是一套子,左不过是些 才子佳人,最没趣儿.

entry.tran: 模式化的形象(或特征);固定模式;刻板印象;陈规老套
entry.def: A stereotype is a fixed general image or set of characteristics that a lot of people believe represent a particular type of person or thing.

example.ex: There's always been a stereotype about successful businessmen...
example.tran: 人们对于成功商人一直都有一种固定印象。

example.ex: Many men feel their body shape doesn't live up to the stereotype of the ideal man.
example.tran: 很多男人都觉得自己的体形不符合人们心目中惯有的理想男性形象。

entry.def: If someone is stereotyped as something, people form a fixed general idea or image of them, so that it is assumed that they will behave in a particular way.

example.ex: He was stereotyped by some as a rebel...
example.tran: 他被一些人认定为叛逆者。

example.ex: I get very worked up about the way women are stereotyped in a lot of mainstream films...
example.tran: 我对很多主流电影中千篇一律的女性形象感到非常气愤。

means.word_mean: 1. lacking spontaneity or originality or individuality;
